etymologies: early 18th century: from Greek idiōmatikos ‘peculiar, characteristic’, from idiōma (see idiom)

definitions: using, containing, or denoting expressions that are natural to a native speaker
shortDefinitions: using, containing, or denoting expressions that are natural to native speaker

definitions: appropriate to the style of art or music associated with a particular period, individual, or group

examples.text: a short Bach piece containing lots of idiomatic motifs

shortDefinitions: appropriate to style of art or music associated with particular period or group
